abstract: Editorial identifies revelations that illustrate how Dodd-Frank financial reform law fell short, such as Goldman Sachs using the bank's money to bet big in real estate, and continuing disruption caused by valuation of Swiss franc; warns that new Republican majority in Congress is committed to weakening law and calls on Democrats and Pres Obama to defend it.
lead_paragraph: Weak rules, political setbacks and budget constraints threaten proper implementation of the law.
snippet: Weak rules, political setbacks and budget constraints threaten proper implementation of the law.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
